lines: Today is Dad's birthday and you would like to make him breakfast.
What kind of eggs do you want to try to make?
You must think that young children can do a lot! The best you can do is throw them raw into a pot and give them to Dad--which is exactly what you do. He's in bed sleeping.
#FEED HIM RAW EGGS WITH A SPOON
Boy, is he surprised. He probably thinks this is going to be the best birthday ever. Mom is laughing very hard. Dad's egg is dripping on the bed.
How do you want to wake him?
He's up. You show him the eggs. I guess he's not really hungry yet. It's the thought that counts.
Daddy wakes up making doggie noises. SNORT! SNORT! GRRRRRRR! You start to feed him the eggs. He runs into the bathroom to wash up. (At least you think he wants to wash up.)

You pour out a bowl of cereal. It keeps coming and coming. Hey! There's a toy in there. You put some milk on it. Oops! Some of it spills on the floor. You take it into Dad. You'll have to wake him up. How do you want to wake him?
He's up. You show him the cereal. I guess he's not really hungry yet. It's the thought that counts.
Daddy wakes up making doggie noises. SNORT! SNORT! GRRRRRRR! You start to feed him the soggy cereal. He runs into the bathroom to wash up. (At least you think he wants to wash up.)
Mom won't let you do exactly what you want but helps you make Dad a nice breakfast. This makes him feel terrific.
You don't know how to be practical yet, silly. Why don't you ask Mom for some help?
You do a lovely job of redecorating the kitchen. When Mom and Dad come into the kitchen, you yell, "Surprise!" They turn around and head back to the bedroom.
